intro: Bactris cyagroides, commonly known as the Guayaba de monte, is a species of palm native to Central and South America. It is a medium-sized tree with a robust trunk and a crown of pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by edible fruits that are typically consumed fresh. Its botanical characteristics include a fibrous trunk and a distinctive, clustered inflorescence. Bactris cyagroides is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
